subject: Sleep
title: What Happens in Deep Sleep
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Happens in Deep Sleep usable.

hook.text: Try waking someone in deep sleep. Shake them, shout their name. They'll be confused, groggy, and disoriented.

buildup.text: Stage N3 is the deepest level of sleep. The brain produces large, slow delta waves rolling like ocean swells.

discovery.text: During N3, growth hormone surges, tissues repair, and the immune system strengthens.

twist.text: N3 dominates the first third of the night. If you go to bed late, you lose disproportionately less N3.

climax.text: That's why the first few hours of sleep feel the most restorative. They contain the most deep sleep.

punchline.text: Deep sleep is frontloaded. Miss it early, lose it completely.

quiz.question: When does most deep sleep occur during the night?
options: In the last third of sleep
In the first third of sleep
